text: What is the best way for a non-CS major to obtain credibility as a programmer?
I did not study CS in college and have been working with a company for almost five years.
During this time I have worked closely with our development team, and have realized I enjoy software development work and coding.
For about three years, I have profusely studied from books: mostly programming languages (C#, Python, and Java) and SQL, but as time and money allow I plan to work into SICP and eventually Knuth.
I have recently joined the company's development team and want to do my best to obtain their respect, which I feel is lacking, since I come from a non-development background.
How can I do this most effectively?
